originalText.text: Had the most AMAZING time touring the Hudson River with Atlantic Yachting!!!!!! Hands down the best way to see NYC. Our tour was on September 11 and we had the most breathtaking view of the Twin Towers memorial and the Statue of Liberty!!!! The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. Jonathan and David went above and beyond with their hospitality. The boat was clean and spacious enough for me and my friends kick back and enjoy the view!!!! The online booking was so easy and convenient, I cant wait to do it again!!! I am so grateful for Atlantic Yachting and the AMAZING memories i got share with my friends!!!!!!

originalText.text:
Could not have had a better time!  3 couples (all from NYC) for two hours sailing on the Hudson. Jonathan (captain) and Taylor (first mate) could not have been more accommodating, friendly and fun.  We showed up with bags of food and drink and taylor took everything below deck and made it a gourmet experience.  We didn't have to lift a finger.  Excellent cocktails, and amazingly presented appetizers.  All we had to do was supply the food and drink and they took care of the rest - platters, glassware, presentation, ice, mixology, you name it.

We felt like we were on a luxury vacation 15 minutes from our apartment.
We felt like multi-millionaires for a couple of hundred dollars per couple.
Can't wait to go again next summer!

originalText.text: I just started private lessons for my ASA101 sailing certification and I could not be more pleased. My instructor, Logan, has been incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, professional, and encouraging. If you have the ability, I would highly recommend private sailing lessons because the shear amount of one-on-one instruction and practice you will receive will make you a much better sailor much faster than other ways of learning.

originalText.text: My friend and I had a fantastic sail with Atlantic Yachting. It's the best way to see NYC - without the rattle of a motor and away from people, you truly feel like you are out in nature, while also being able to look back at the city of 8 million people. We departed for a sunset cruise, and the angle of the sun is spectacular. You get the full shift from bright orange through to purple/pink/cobalt, and the final rays of sun are gleaming off the skyscrapers fronting the Hudson. We could see everything from Empire State and Chrysler, down to the World Trade Center. The boat was clean, and the staff was friendly, professional, and personable. Our Captain Dave gave us plenty of insight, including that the lights on top of the buildings of Times Sq can be controlled by an app! Absolutely going to go again!

originalText.text: My family loves Atlantic Yachting.  Our girls (9 and 11) took a week of sailing camp this past summer and enjoyed it so much that we signed up for a second week at the last minute.  Then, when we took out some catamarans on our own for some family sailing later in the summer, the girls' comfort level with sailing was evident.  Finally, my wife and I have done two three-hour sails with Logan at Atlantic Yachting this month (why should the kids have all the fun?). A couple of weeks ago, the winds were really light; today, it was blowing.  It's a real credit to Logan that we had a great time on both of the sails.  We so enjoyed both Logan's teaching (which he made appropriate for our intermediate sailing skills) and his company.
